result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Mydrell M Smith in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.

Defendant Mydrell M Smith in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.


BTC: Bond may be modified to extend employment through any entity as long as it's cleared through ZCI.

ALONG WITH $2,500.00 CO-SIGNATURE BOND TO BE CO-SIGNED WITH PARENTS-FATHER MAX SMITH DOB 09-27-1968 AND MOTHER-TAUNESHE DAVIS, DOB 12-04-1971 WITH PHOTO ID'S. Cts 1 & 2: 946.49(1)(b)-Bail Jumping-Felony. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.    Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Defendant to be on house arrest with exceptions of pre-approval from ZCI for defendant to work with his father, go to appointments with his attorney, and make all court appearances. Defendant is to obey all rules of the confines of parents' home. If he does not, parents are to report infractions. Defendant is not to hang out with any known gang members. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 09-23-2014 - DEFENDANT IS ALLOWED OUT FOR ANY EMPLOYMENT AS LONG AS IT'S CLEARED WITH ZCI

Status conference on September 29, 2014 at 09:30 am.
NG plea entered.

Defendant Mydrell M Smith in court with attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Defendant Mydrell M Smith in custody.  Sharon A. Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght.
The State asked for partial transcript from last week's hearing but the Court reporter has not gotten it done. Since it hasn't been completed, the State calls Michelle Marie Anderson - DSAT. Direct by the State. The State asks the Court to take judical notice of bond forms in 13CF1529 and 14CF17. The Court takes judicial notice. The State rests. Defense has no witnesses.

Defense asks that bond be reviewed without formal motion to the Court. Ms. Anderson joins in bond motion request for cases 13CF1529 and 14CF17. The State refers to the bond motion that it filed requesting bonds be increased. The State previously has asked bonds be increased to $5,000.00 cash in each file and renews that request today. Ms. Anderson is asking that the bonds be reduced to allow only another $250.00 cash to be posted in each case. Mr. Barth asks for signature bond in lieu of cash. Defendant's parents are willing to co-sign bond.  The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant's father.

The State recites deft's prior criminal record for this Court record.

BTC: There is PC. Defendant is bound over for trial. Bond modification on all files is granted. Bonds shall be modified - 14CF17 - cash posted shall remain. $2500.00 co-signature with both parents as well. Max Smith, DOB 9/27/68 and Tauneshe Davis 12/04/71
1529-cash posted remains $2,500.00 co-signaure with both parents as well
14CF910-$10,000.00 total. $1,000.00 cash, $9,000.00 co-signature by both parents. No alc/cs, do not hang out with known gang members, house arrest with GPS monitoring with exceptions of pre-approval from ZCI, deft may work with father, make appointments with attorney and to come to court. Defendant must obey all rules of the confines of parent's home. If he does not, parents must report infractions. 
  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
